title: How to Use Pixlr‐O‐Matic

steps.headline: When it has finished loading, it will ask you to choose an image from a web cam, computer or you can try their own.
You should end up opening the editor now.
If you go to the next section, you'll choose your overlays.
steps.description: Choose which ever one you want. Try to be as creative as possible! Which ever one you click on, the slide will slide to the right if you're selecting the one nearer to the right. You can simply swipe it too with your mouse.

steps.headline: The last section is where you choose your border.
steps.description: Choose which ever one you want.

steps.headline: Click on the film with the plus sign if you want more effects.
When you're done, click on the 'Save button'.
Choose where you want it to save in.
Write the name for your image and choose the place and that's al.

text:
Opening the Site Open up Pixlr's website. Go to http://pixlr.com/ and select 'Pixlr-o-matic (Playful). When it has finished loading, it will ask you to choose an image from a web cam, computer or you can try their own. Start Editing You should end up opening the editor now. Click on the two arrows on the two ends to navigate your way through effects, overlays then borders. You could also press the speed-o-meter in the middle of the page. Choose your Effects. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} You can crop it, have extra effects, etc. by clicking on one of the buttons to the left of the speed-o-meter. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If you go to the next section, you'll choose your overlays. Choose which ever one you want. Try to be as creative as possible! Which ever one you click on, the slide will slide to the right if you're selecting the one nearer to the right. You can simply swipe it too with your mouse. The last section is where you choose your border. Choose which ever one you want. Click on the film with the plus sign if you want more effects. Once you have clicked on it, choose which category you want to browse. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Select which category you want. If you select one, it will be in your category's slide so you have to find it. It should be the last one. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Select the sub-category border etc. (make sure it has the film sign, which ever one's don't have the film sign will not be included) and then press okay. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} There you go, your border. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Use-Pixlr%E2%80%90O%E2%80%90Matic-Step-6Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} When you're done, click on the 'Save button'. Choose where you want it to save in. Write the name for your image and choose the place and that's al. You're done! Finished.
